name: Remarks/record (e.g. Test frequency reports, certificates, checklist etc.) -
Acceptance criteria - Prior to the commencement of works, the contractor shall engage a suitably qualified surveyor to set out the works and clearly mark its limits.
Acceptance criteria - Asphalt types specified within IFC Drawings.
40mm wearing course size 10mm Type H (C320) Asphalt 7mm Cationic rapid setting (CSR) emulsified primerseal (C170); or primer AMCO
Acceptance criteria - Asphalt mix has not been stored in a hot bin for more than 18 hours prior to use.
Acceptance criteria - Surface on which asphalt is to be placed is dry, free from surface water & has a surface temperature >10⁰C
Acceptance criteria - Crushed rock surface to be primed prior to placement of asphalt.
Acceptance criteria - All asphalt shall be spread with an asphalt paver except for small areas where use of a paver is not practicable.
• All asphalt shall be spread to form a uniformly smooth asphalt mat without segregation, tearing or gouging.
Remarks/record (e.g. Test frequency reports, certificates, checklist etc.) -
Acceptance criteria - If the paver is required to stop & asphalt in front of the screed cools to below 120⁰C, a transverse joint shall be constructed.
• Longitudinal joints in the wearing course shall be parallel to the traffic lanes.
Acceptance criteria - The finished surface of asphalt wearing course shall be of uniform appearance, free of dragged areas, cracks, open textured patches & roller marks.
• Where asphalt is placed against kerb, the surface at the edge of the wearing course shall be either flush with or not more than 5mm above the lip of the channel.
• No point on the finished surface of the wearing course shall lie more than 4mm below a 3m straight edge laid either parallel to the centreline.
Acceptance criteria - Testing to be undertaken in accordance with XXX
Remarks/record (e.g. Test frequency reports, certificates, checklist etc.) -
Acceptance criteria - Measurements have been taken randomly throughout the lot & are within tolerance.

Acceptance criteria - Survey setout extend of works
Freq - Prior to start of Works
Acceptance criteria - Have all trees / native flora and fauna been protected including the establishment of no go zones as indicated in the construction documentation, CHMP and CAB?
Freq - Prior to start of Works
Acceptance criteria - Have the identified areas been cleared of all vegetation, refuse, unsuitable material and obstructions down to natural surface?
• In areas where excavation will be made, all vegetation, refuse and obstructions shall be totally grubbed.
• Unsuitable material and topsoil is to be stockpiled in the designated location and is not to be used as fill material.
Acceptance criteria - Is the appropriate equipment being used to ensure topsoil and subsoil layers are not mixed.

Acceptance criteria - Has the area been stripped and stockpiled to an appropriate depth (minimum top 50mm) removing surface topsoil and unsuitable material in a way to leave the surface evenly graded and free-draining?
Acceptance criteria - Has the topsoil being stockpiled been approved by RJE (where applicable).
• Have the environmental controls as per CEMP been adhered to?
• Dispose material as per CEMP requirements

name: Remarks/record (e.g. Test frequency reports, certificates, checklist etc.) -

Acceptance criteria - Prior to excavations being carried out, the contractor shall engage a suitably qualified surveyor to set out all drainage lines including manholes, temporary benchmarks, sewage wet wells etc.
• Chainage, offsets, cut/fill level, cutting slopes, grades and cross sections specified or shown on the drawings, etc.
Acceptance criteria - In accordance with IFC Drawings:
• All pipework to be clearly labelled & detectable to identify it as stormwater drainage.
Remarks/record (e.g. Test frequency reports, certificates, checklist etc.) -
Acceptance criteria - All excavations subject to inspection prior to the installation of services and throughout the duration of the excavation.
• Excavate to the lines, levels and grades as required for in ground services specified in accordance with the requirements of AS 3500.
• Keep trench width & depth to that required by the service & its bedding method.
Acceptance criteria - Remove obstructions including roots, stumps, boulders and the like which may interfere with the proper functioning of the service
Acceptance criteria - Symal shall maintain all excavations in a well-drained condition.
• No bedding material or pipe work shall be placed in excavations containing standing or running water.
Acceptance criteria - All Pipes shall be installed with well graded washed clean sand to AS3725
• Bedding material to be placed the full width of the trench and not less than 100mm in thickness.
Acceptance criteria - Bedding material shall be compacted to refusal handheld mechanical equipment.
Acceptance criteria - All excavations subject to inspection prior to the installation of services and throughout the duration of the excavation.
• Pipes shall be bedded evenly to ensure sockets to not bear on the base of the trench
• Pipe laying shall commence at upstream end at downstream end of the run. All pipes shall be laid with sockets pointing upstream.
• Excavate to the lines, levels and grades as required for in ground services specified in accordance with the requirements of AS 3500.
• Keep trench width & depth to that required by the service & its bedding method.
Acceptance criteria - Install piping in straight lines at uniform grades without sags.
Remarks/record (e.g. Test frequency reports, certificates, checklist etc.) -
Acceptance criteria - Unless otherwise specified, tolerances as follows:
• Offset of entry pits required to match lines of kerbs or barriers ±20mm
• Plan location of pits other than offsets to kerb lines or barriers ±100mm
• Invert level of pipes at pits ±50mm
• Departure from design grade of pipe runs ±10mm in 10m provided minimum grade is not less than 1:250
Remarks/record (e.g. Test frequency reports, certificates, checklist etc.) -
Acceptance criteria - Provide all bends, junctions, inspection openings and other fittings as necessary for the completion of all systems.

Acceptance criteria - Pits are to be constructed in accordance with project specifications, with internal surfaces and exposed surfaces finished smooth & true. All pipe break-ins are to be made neat and finished smooth without gaps/cavities.
Acceptance criteria - Accurately record the routes of underground cables and pipes before backfilling. Include on the record drawings.

Acceptance criteria - After pipes & fittings have been set in the correct position, jointed, and tested, further bedding material shall be used to fill all recesses below sockets, and bottoms of trenches.
Acceptance criteria - Backfill material must be placed and compacted in maximum 150mm layers.
• Backfill trenches as soon as possible after satisfactory testing & approval of laid and bedded service.
Acceptance criteria - Layers must achieve 98% Standard Compaction at optimum moisture conditions.
Remarks/record (e.g. Test frequency reports, certificates, checklist etc.) -
Acceptance criteria - On completion, each drainage line shall be free from dirt, debris, or other impediments.
Remarks/record (e.g. Test frequency reports, certificates, checklist etc.) -
Acceptance criteria - Do not cover or conceal work until it has been tested. Leave pipe joints exposed to enable witness testing.
Lot Status

name: Acceptance criteria - Prior to the commencement of works, the contractor shall engage a suitably qualified surveyor to set out the works and clearly mark its limits.
Remarks/record (e.g. Test frequency reports, certificates, checklist etc.) -

Acceptance criteria - Where kerb is constructed over pavement layers, bedding shall be provided between the pavement layer & the underside of the edging, or the edging thickened to match the pavement layer.
• Where edgings are not constructed over pavement layers, bedding shall be greater than 100mm compacted thickness.
Acceptance criteria - Concrete shall not be mixed when the temperature is lower than 5⁰C or greater than 35⁰C.

Acceptance criteria - Concrete shall be thoroughly compacted by means of continuous tamping & internal vibration shall be worked around any embedment’s & into corners of formwork to produce a dense concrete free from voids, honeycombing, segregation, or surface defects.
• Concrete shall be finished to ensure a smooth surface with a uniform colour & appearance, & screeded to achieve the specified level, dimensions, falls & tolerances.

Acceptance criteria - Transverse joints shall be constructed at regular intervals not exceeding 3m. For extruded edgings this shall be done by a method which does not damage or distort the adjacent surfaces.
• 6mm saw cut joints within 24-72hrs post pour
• Sikaflex polyurethane joint sealant or equivalent used to fill saw cuts.
Acceptance criteria - Correct kerb type installed as per IFC drawings.
• Line & level confirmed at time of pour.

• Is the subgrade material with 2% of the optimum moisture content.
• Is the subgrade within +/- 20mm of design surface?
